title: Biden meets top Chinese diplomat as rivals seek to manage tensions
description: Wang Yi’s visit to Washington ended without a major breakthrough in U.S.-China relations, officials said, but the trip was seen as a positive development.

title: Israel expands ground operations in Gaza war amid U.S. calls for restraint
description: The announcement of expanded ground operations came amid a near-total collapse of the internet across Gaza.

title: How Hamas broke through Israel’s border defenses during Oct. 7 attack
description: Hamas systematically disabled key communications and warning systems on Oct. 7, allowing gunmen to overwhelm Israeli military bases and kill soldiers in their bunks.

title: Prosecutors want Brazil’s oldest bank to pay reparations for slavery
description: Banco do Brasil doesn’t deny its ties to 19th century slavery but says it shouldn’t be held responsible for the sins of a society.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: U.S. hits Iran-linked targets in Syria, as it tries to contain Mideast conflict
description: U.S. forces struck two sites used by Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and other groups, after 21 American personnel in the Middle East were injured.

title: For Putin foe Alexey Navalny, Ukraine has long been a volatile issue
description: A biography of Alexey Navalny, to be published next week, examines his long, fraught history with Ukraine as an important part of his Russian political life.

title: The ‘impossible choices’ facing Palestinians in Gaza
description: Amid nearly three punishing weeks of Israel’s bombardment and siege, the options for Gaza’s residents are grim.

title: For New Zealand’s Maori communities, climate change is already hurting
description: Indigenous communities along New Zealand’s long coastline are feeling the double whammy of climate change and colonialism as extreme weather makes marginal land uninhabitable.

title: U.S. strikes Iran-linked sites in Syria after attacks on American troops
description: U.S. forces struck sites in Syria associated with Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and other militants, a response to recent attacks on U.S. personnel.

title: Former Chinese premier and one-time Xi rival Li Keqiang dies at 68
description: Li, who served as premier for a decade until March this year, was nominally in charge of China’s economy but was increasingly sidelined as Xi Jinping cemented control.

title: She was discovered as a 500-year-old Incan mummy. Now, she has a face.
description: Researchers have re-created the face of Juanita, an Incan girl preserved as a frozen mummy in the Andes after a human sacrifice around 500 years ago.
